title: Gautam Adani, Family Attend Grand Jagannath Rath Yatra In Puri

title: 70-Year-Old Duped Of Rs 3 Crore, Kept Under 'Digital Arrest' For 8 days

title: 2 Minors Slit Man's Throat, Steal iPhone To Create 'High-Quality Reels'
content: Two minors allegedly killed a man by slitting his throat and then crushed his head with a stone to steal his iPhone to create "high-quality reels" for more likes, police said on Saturday.

title: Padma Awardee Monk Accused Of Rape, Abortion, Threats By Bengal Woman

title: "Dangerous Extremist Propaganda": How A Bald JD Vance Meme Got Tourist Banned From US
content: Mikkelsen said that the entire episode had been traumatic because of strip-searches, luggage ransacking, fingerprinting, blood sampling and falsified travel records. His Norwegian passport had also been mistakenly labelled as "Spanish".

title: Kerala mother donates part of her liver to save ailing baby
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a mother donated a portion of her liver to save her life . the mother donated the liver to help her save her liver . she is now recovering from a heart attack .

title: 'Explosive-laden vehicle hit convoy': 16 Pakistan troops killed in suicide attack
content: A suicide attack, claimed by the Pakistani Taliban, targeted a military convoy in North Waziristan, resulting in the deaths of 16 soldiers and injuries to over two dozen individuals, including civilians. The bomber used an explosive-laden vehicle, causing significant damage and casualties.

title: Kolkata rape case: BJP forms committee; slams TMC for 'state-sponsored brutality'
content: BJP criticized the TMC government following a reported gangrape at a Kolkata law college, alleging the main accused's connection to TMC. Sambit Patra claimed the incident appeared state-sponsored due to the accused's TMC affiliation. BJP President JP Nadda formed a committee, including Satpal Singh and Meenakshi Lekhi, to investigate the matter and submit a report.

title: UP horror: YouTuber drugged, sexually assaulted by vlogger during shoot
content: A 17-year-old social media content creator was allegedly drugged and sexually assaulted by a video blogger during a shoot at a Gorakhpur club. The incident came to light after the girl's family filed a police complaint. Police have arrested the main accused, a Raptinagar resident, and are investigating the involvement of two others. The survivor is receiving mental health support.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi blames PM Modi for 'conspiring to strip Bihar of voting rights'
content: Tejashwi Yadav, RJD leader, accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of influencing the Election Commission to cancel Bihar's voter list and create a new one based on pre-1987 documents. He alleged this is a conspiracy to disenfranchise voters and deprive them of welfare benefits. Yadav stated he discussed the issue with opposition alliance members, ahead of the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah hits the nets as Team India focuses on bowling drills
content: Jasprit Bumrah's return to training has boosted India's bowling preparations for the Edgbaston Test after their Headingley defeat. Bumrah, Prasidh Krishna, and Mohammed Siraj bowled in the nets, injecting intensity into the team's practice. While Bumrah's inclusion remains uncertain due to workload management, his presence offers hope as Team India aims to level the series.

title: Axiom-4 mission: Crew settles in at ISS; Shubhanshu Shukla will sleep in 'Dragon'
content: Following their arrival at the International Space Station, the Axiom-4 crew, including Peggy Whitson, is being assisted by Expedition 73 in acclimating to the orbital environment and preparing for microgravity research. The crews are collaborating on unloading cargo, reviewing safety protocols, and familiarizing themselves with station systems. Expedition 73 is maintaining its research schedule while supporting the Axiom-4 mission.

title: Rescheduling chaos: Flyer says family split across 3 flights; 'had to change all plans'
content: Air India passengers are facing significant disruptions due to flight cancellations and schedule changes. Anish Agarwal's family's Toronto-Pune trip was split across multiple days, while a Pune family's Mumbai-Newark flight was abruptly cancelled, leading to re-routing. These issues stem from fleet reductions, causing international travelers to experience delays, extended layovers, and lack of compensation, sparking widespread frustration.

title: US immigration authority to Visa applicants: Effective July 1, 2025, USCIS will no longer send ...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: 'Barbados will forever be in my veins': Rohit relives India’s T20 WC 2024 glory
content: Rohit Sharma reminisces about India's triumphant ICC T20 World Cup 2024 victory, highlighting the thrilling final against South Africa and a tense, low-scoring match against Pakistan. He praises the team's resilience and the crucial performances of Bumrah, Arshdeep, and Pant. The victory ended a 17-year drought, creating unforgettable memories for the nation.

title: Iran buries top military commanders killed in Israel war; thousands join in funeral
content: Iran held a state funeral in Tehran for approximately 60 individuals, including military commanders and 14 nuclear scientists, who died in the conflict with Israel. The ceremony commenced in Islamic Revolution Square, attended by government officials and mourners waving Iranian flags. Among the deceased were Major General Mohammad Bagheri and nuclear scientist Mohammad Mehdi Tehranchi, both to be buried alongside their families.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; predicts it will lead world
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: 'Time to bring in Kuldeep Yadav': Ex-India cricketers drop big hint
content: Following their defeat in the first Test, India is contemplating changes for the second Test against England at Edgbaston. Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to workload management. Kuldeep Yadav's inclusion is strongly considered, given England's struggles against wrist spin.

title: ‘Nazi Ancestor Pass’: Derek O’Brien targets Election Commission over NRC
content: Derek O'Brien and Asaduddin Owaisi have strongly criticized the Election Commission of India's voter verification drive in Bihar and West Bengal. They allege it's a disguised attempt to implement the NRC, potentially disenfranchising many, especially the poor.

title: IND vs ENG | Yashasvi Jaiswal on brink of history, eyes 49-year-old record in Edgbaston
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal is on the verge of breaking Sunil Gavaskar's 49-year-old record to become the fastest Indian to reach 2000 Test runs. He needs just 97 runs in the upcoming Edgbaston Test against England to surpass Gavaskar, who achieved the milestone in 23 Tests. Jaiswal's recent century in Leeds has fueled anticipation for this historic feat.

title: $30bn for Iran nuclear program? 'Ridiculous idea', says Trump; dismisses report
content: Donald Trump has vehemently denied reports suggesting his administration considered a $30 billion deal to aid Iran in developing a civil nuclear program. He dismissed the reports as "fake news" and a "hoax" intended to demean him.

title: Campus safety in focus: Law college gangrape triggers RG Kar case memories
content: A 24-year-old law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped on her college campus by an ex-student leader and two junior students. The survivor reported the assault occurred after she rejected a marriage proposal, leading to her abduction and sexual assault in a security room.

title: Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra: 750 fall ill from heat and crowding; 12 in ICU
content: During the Rath Yatra in Puri, approximately 750 devotees were hospitalized due to exhaustion and crowd pressure. Health officials reported that over 230 individuals were admitted to the Infectious Disease Hospital, while around 520 received treatment at the district headquarters hospital.

title: Online dating app turns costly: 63-yr-old Bengal man duped of Rs 66.6 lakh
content: A 63-year-old Salt Lake resident was swindled out of Rs 66.6 lakh in an online investment scam after connecting with a woman on a dating app. The woman persuaded him to invest, promising high returns, and added him to a Telegram group.

title: Gurgaon shocker: 29-year-old MNC executive found dead; cops quiz boyfriend
content: Gurgaon police are investigating the death of a 29-year-old woman found in her DLF-3 apartment after a foul smell was reported. The woman, an orphan from Najafgarh, Delhi, was reportedly in a seven-year relationship with a man who last saw her on Monday.

title: Mid-air depressurisation: Mumbai-bound flight makes emergency landing; 7 ill
content: An Ethiopian Airlines flight, ET640, en route to Mumbai from Addis Ababa, made an emergency landing early Friday due to cabin depressurization. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner was over the Arabian Sea when the incident occurred, prompting a rapid descent. Upon landing, medical personnel attended to seven passengers experiencing decompression-related symptoms, with one requiring hospitalization.

title: Garrett Wilson & Shay Holle stun on Italy getaway; couple shares photos; fans react
content: New York Jets wide receiver Garret Wilson and his girlfriend, Shay Holle, enjoyed a vacation in Italy. The couple shared photos of their trip on social media. Fans reacted to the images of the couple. Wilson posted photos of Italian streets. The couple's relationship became public in April. Wilson is preparing for his third NFL season with the Jets.

title: 'Want to unveil real face': Bengal woman accuses Padma Shri awardee of rape
content: A woman filed a police complaint against Padma Shri awardee Swami Pradiptanandaji. She alleged repeated rape at Bharat Sevashram Sangha in Murshidabad. The woman claimed she was promised a teaching job. She further stated she was forced to undergo an abortion. BJP leaders are calling it a conspiracy. Trinamool Congress demands a thorough investigation.

title: Vande Bharat train scuffle: BJP MLA denies role; says 'passenger provoked me'
content: Babina MLA Rajeev Singh Parichha addressed the Vande Bharat Express assault, denying direct involvement but admitting his security guard summoned people fearing a further altercation after a seat exchange dispute. He claims he tried to stop the attack and has asked the GRP to take action.

title: 'Humbly accept it as prasad': PM Modi honoured as 'Dharma Chakravarti'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the ‘Dharma Chakravarti’ title at  Vidyanand's centenary. The event took place at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. It marked the start of a year-long tribute. Vidyanand's contributions were showcased. He designed the Jain Flag and Emblem. The centenary will feature cultural, literary, and spiritual programs.

title: Kolkata law student rape case: College security guard held; 4th arrest made
content: West Bengal Police have arrested a fourth individual in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a law student at a Kolkata college. The survivor, from South 24 Parganas, reported being sexually assaulted in the college's security guards' room after being offered a student union post. Manojit Mishra, a former student, along with Pramit Mukherjee and Zaib Ahmed, were previously arrested.

title: Yemen launches barrage of missiles; Israel says 'most likely intercepted'
content: The Israeli army reported detecting a missile launch from Yemen aimed at Israeli territory, triggering sirens in southern Israel. Israel's aerial defense systems were activated to intercept the incoming projectile. The IDF communicated the urgent situation via Telegram, emphasizing ongoing efforts to neutralize the threat and protect civilians.

title: Birthright citizenship: US limits nationwide injunctions – what it means for immigrants
content: The US Supreme Court limited lower courts' power to issue nationwide injunctions, impacting immigration law. This allows President Trump's order ending birthright citizenship for children of undocumented immigrants to take effect in 28 states. While the policy remains blocked in 22 states, immigrant rights groups fear legal confusion and potential statelessness for newborns.

title: France bans outdoor smoking: Parks, beaches, schools included
content: France is set to implement a smoking ban in various public spaces starting Sunday, including beaches, parks, and bus shelters. The new decree aims to protect children from passive smoking, extending the prohibition to areas outside schools and swimming pools. Violators will face a fine of 135 euros.

title: Neeraj Chopra thinks this cricketer could dominate javelin too- Watch
content: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra believes Jasprit Bumrah possesses the fitness and strength to excel in javelin throw, highlighting the crossover of athletic abilities. Bumrah's impressive 2024 performance includes 78 wickets in 15 Test matches, leading all fast bowlers globally in wickets and overs bowled.

title: 'Tufano ko ... ': Suryavanshi's Bollywood-inspired post after 5 sixes
content: India's Under-19 team showcased their dominance by defeating England in the first Youth ODI with a six-wicket victory. Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old debutant, stole the show with a rapid 48 off 19 balls. Abhigyan Kundu's anchored innings ensured a comfortable chase, complementing the bowlers' effort in restricting England to 174.

title: In 24 hrs: Trump's 'no trade barrier' pitch for India; signs China deal, snubs Canada
content: President Trump is aggressively reshaping US trade policy, initiating swift actions against Canada over its digital services tax by halting trade talks and threatening tariffs. Simultaneously, he's pursuing a significant trade agreement with India, aiming to dismantle existing barriers. A confirmed deal with China, focused on rare earth minerals, signals a broader strategy to assert American dominance in global commerce.

title: CBSE board exams twice a year: Why it matters; expert tips to maximize both attempts
content: Starting in 2025, CBSE is introducing a twice-a-year board exam model for Class 10, aligning with NEP 2020. This initiative aims to reduce student stress by offering a second chance to improve scores. Students can strategically use both sessions to enhance their performance and balance board preparation with entrance exam studies.

title: Kolkata gangrape case: RG Kar victim's father slams TMC; says 'govt has a significant role'
content: A female law student was allegedly gang-raped inside her college in South Kolkata's Kasba area, sparking outrage and raising concerns about women's safety. Following the incident, police swiftly arrested three individuals, identified as former students or staff of the college. The arrests occurred within 12 hours of the complaint, prompting political reactions and demands for strict punishment.

title: CJI Gavai reflects on early struggles; gets emotional
content: Chief Justice of India, Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, shared his personal journey at a Nagpur event, recalling his family's sacrifices and his father's dream of him becoming a lawyer dedicated to social good, inspired by Dr. BR Ambedkar. Gavai, who initially wanted to be an architect, also humorously recounted a cheque bounce case involving actor Hema Malini.

title: Love, faith, & vegetarian life: Usha Vance opens up on life as US second lady
content: Second Lady Usha Vance offers a glimpse into her interfaith marriage with Vice President J.D. Vance, highlighting their open conversations about faith and cultural traditions. She shares how they navigate raising their children in a Catholic school while ensuring they have access to Hindu culture through family and travel. Usha also discusses her vegetarian upbringing and J.D.'s culinary experiments.

title: 'Live-ins clash with values': HC on bail plea in rape-on-marriage-pledge case
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to Shane Alam, accused of sexual exploitation. The court observed live-in relationships clash with Indian middle-class values. Justice Siddharth's bench expressed concern over rising cases related to live-in arrangements. The court noted women often face difficulties after such relationships end. Alam was booked under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the Pocso Act.

title: 'He didn’t let me go': Kolkata law student gangraped after rejecting proposal
content: A law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped in her college's security room after being lured with the promise of a key union post. Police have arrested three individuals, including a college alumnus and two current students, following the survivor's complaint and medical corroboration.

title: 'Aircraft malfunction': Chinese domestic flight makes emergency landing in Nanjing
content: Shandong Airlines flight SC4667, traveling from Qingdao to Shanghai, made an emergency landing in Nanjing due to a reported burning odor and suspected engine malfunction. Passengers described feeling terrified as the plane shook, but praised the crew's handling of the situation and the pilot's smooth landing. The airline ensured all passengers were accommodated and arranged for a replacement aircraft.

title: Prada bows! Italian brand forced to credit Kolhapuri designs; legal options being mulled
content: Prada's 2026 menswear line, featuring sandals resembling Kolhapuri chappals, has sparked controversy in India over cultural appropriation. While Prada acknowledges the design's inspiration and commits to engaging with Indian artisans, LIDCOM is considering legal action due to the lack of credit and potential GI violation.

title: 'Had no choice but to run to daddy': Iran's sharp jibe at Israel
content: Iranian foreign minister Araghchi urged Donald Trump to retract his "disrespectful" remarks about Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, emphasizing that such rhetoric hinders potential nuclear deal negotiations. Araghchi's statement follows recent tensions, including Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and retaliatory missile launches.

title: Rohit Sharma takes a break, spotted vacationing in Milan with wife Ritika
content: Amidst India's struggle against England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, former captain Rohit Sharma's Milan vacation sparked debate. Shubman Gill, succeeding Sharma, faced criticism after a defeat at Headingley. Despite centuries from multiple Indian batsmen, batting collapses and dropped catches led to England's victory. Nasser Hussain pointed out Gill's reactive captaincy, contrasting it with Sharma and Kohli's proactive leadership.

title: Ghana, Argentina, Brazil & more: PM Modi on 5-nation tour; what's on agenda?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will soon be embarking on a significant multi-nation tour from July 2-9, aimed at strengthening India's global partnerships. He will visit Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil for the BRICS summit, and Namibia. These visits aim to enhance bilateral relations, focusing on economic, energy, defense, and trade collaborations.

title: 'No excuses left' – Former India cricketer turns up the heat on Gambhir
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, faces increasing scrutiny after the team's struggles in Test cricket, highlighted by a recent defeat to England under Shubman Gill's captaincy. With only one win in the last nine Tests, including series losses to New Zealand and Australia, pressure mounts. Aakash Chopra emphasizes the need for results, noting the selectors' support.

title: 20 years after split, Uddhav & Raj join hands to oppose 'Hindi imposition' in Maha
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray are set to unite for a joint protest march on July 5 against the alleged imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra schools. This marks their first political collaboration in two decades, sparking speculation of a potential reunion for upcoming civic polls.

title: Angel Reese sends message to brother Julian after Lakers deal; reminds him, ‘Time to work’
content: Julian Reese, brother of Angel Reese, is now with the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers signed the former Maryland Terrapins player. Angel Reese expressed her joy and support on social media. She reminded Julian that the real work is just beginning. Julian Reese had a successful college career. He aims to make a mark in the NBA.

title: Madrid win group, Man City get dominant win over Juventus
content: Xabi Alonso's real madrid started to take shape at the 2025 club world cup . a reborn vincius Jnior scored a superb goal for a backheel . the defending champions were 2-0 up at halftime at Lincoln Financial Field .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Man kills daughter for wanting to marry against family’s wishes in Cuddalore
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a 52-year-old man was arrested on friday (july 27) in a homicide . the man was charged with aggravated battery on january 27 .

title: Mock drafts, rankings, order, analysis and more
content: the 2025 draft is set for July 13-14 in Atlanta, Georgia . the first round begins at 6 p.m. ET and will be broadcast live on ESPN and MLB Network . coverage of day 2 of the draft will be streamed on MLB.com beginning at 11:30 a.m .

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal during the NBA draft
content: the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as the Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets . Jrue Holiday also was traded from the Boston Celtics to the Portland Trail Blazers on Monday for guard Anfernee Simons and two future second-round picks.

title: Can Ilia Topuria do everything left on his UFC to-do list by 30?
content: Ilia Topuria reveals his future fight plans if he beats Charles Oliveira for the vacant lightweight title . the 28-year-old will look to become a two-weight champion on saturday . topuria said retirement comments from December were heavily influenced by the drastic amount of weight he had to cut to make the featherweight limit .

title: Best picks, surprising moves and top trades: Making sense of Round 1
content: the 2025 draft began with the first of three players selected by the Dallas Mavericks . it ended with the LA Clippers drafting center Yanic Konan Niederhauser with pick no. 30 . the Phoenix Suns landing the top-ranked center in Duke's Khaman Maluach .

title: NBA 2K25 gets finals prediction right, NHL 25 continues to miss
content: NBA 2K25 correctly predicted the Oklahoma City Thunder to take the title over the Indiana Pacers . 2K Games' simulation forecast a more decisive 4-2 victory for OKC . the point difference between the two teams ended up being only two points off the predicted value .

title: NBA free agency: Grading the biggest moves, including Naz Reid's new deal
content: the offseason is here, and teams are making moves to fill their rosters for the 2025-26 season . the move comes after a strong season as the backup center for the Western Conference's no. 2 seed . we're grading the moves and examining what each means for the season and beyond .

title: Who could be a WNBA All-Star starter? Predictions, questions, more for 2025
content: fans' votes count for 50%, players count for 25% . top four guards and top six frontcourt players will be the starters . coaches cannot vote for players on their own teams . the two players with the most fan votes will serve as captains and draft players on "WNBA Countdown"

title: College Football 26 confirms new mascots, other presentation details
content: college football 26's lighting system will correctly simulate regional and seasonal time of day . a primetime game against big rivals will trigger an epic runout . more regular matches without the extra context will feature more modest festivities .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal go up against Spurs for Eberechi Eze
content: arsenal have stepped up their efforts to beat rivals Tottenham Hotspur in the race for Eberechi Eze . the public investment fund has made an offer to Lionel Messi to bring him to Saudi Arabia . moretto - atlético Madrid cool Andy Robertson interest, Matteo Ruggeri close to joining Mallorca .

title: Which NBA teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .
